feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 4:15AM AKST until January 31 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Additional snow accumulations of one inch are expected. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued January 29 at 10:45AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM NOON AKST TODAY UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect from noon AKST today until noon AKST Monday. Fairbanks has a Stage 2 alert.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 3:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The Roaring Fork River in portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Eagle and Garfield. In west central Colorado, Pitkin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 3:04AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ELEVATED FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon into the evening. Winds will be from the southwest at 10 to 15 MPH and with gusts up to 25 MPH.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 3:50AM MST until January 31 at 7:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTERY WEATHER FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST INTO MONDAY... .Heavier Snow in the mountains and valleys is expected to increase later Sunday with snow persisting into Monday for the mountains. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 28 at 12:29PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ice jams will continue to build on the Salmon River downstream of the town of Salmon... Below zero low temperatures through the weekend will accelerate ice build up on the Salmon River downstream of the town of Salmon through the North Fork. As the ice jam worsens, water will begin to back up, leading to a rise in river levels. Low lying areas along
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lemhi

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 30 at 4:11AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Potential for heavy rainfall between Tuesday night into Thursday... A large scale weather system is expected to impact parts of the Quad State region with moderate to locally heavy rainfall between Tuesday night into Thursday. Nearly all of the moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected just ahead of an Arctic cold front that will slowly work southeast

entry.summary: ...PATCHY BLACK ICE EXPECTED ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS THIS MORNING... Recent snowfall has left behind some slippery spots on untreated roadways. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 3:42AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near critical fire danger this afternoon... Be very careful with any open flames or hot implements today.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 4:36AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...MUCH COLDER AND WINTRY PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE LATE THIS WEEK... WHAT: An arctic airmass will build south across west central Texas, bringing the coldest air so far this winter. Temperatures may stay below freezing for several consecutive days. In addition, periods of wintry precipitation are likely mainly Wednesday night and Thursday.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1000 feet. entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 2:50AM PST until January 31 at 6:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTERY WEATHER FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST INTO MONDAY... .Heavier Snow in the mountains and valleys is expected to increase later Sunday with snow persisting into Monday for the mountains. Mixed wintry weather with rain, snow and a little sleet or freezing rain can be expected in the south parts of eastern Washington and Idaho Panhandle.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeast Mountains
